intro: Benthamia chlorantha, commonly known as the green benthamia, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, typically in clusters along the stems. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Due to its unique adaptations, it is well-suited for xeriscaping and requires minimal water once established.
